gurmukhi: sINgn qy gih fwr dXo su ATwrh pYg pY jwie prXo hY ] Pyir auTXo kr kop mnY hir ky iPr swmuih ju`Du krXo hY ]
transliteration: Singad Te Gadh Daar Dayo Su Athaarah Paig Pai Jaae Daryo Hai|| Pher(i) Outhyo Kar Kop Manai Har(i) Ke Phir Saamuh(i) Juddh(u) Daryo Hai||
translation: Catching hold of his horns, Krishna threw him away at a distance of eighteen steps; then he, greatly infuriated, got up and began to fight in front of Krishna;

gurmukhi: Pyir bgwie dIXo hirjU khI jwie igrXo su nhI aubrXo hY ] moC BeI iqhkI hir ky kr CUvq hI su lrXo n mrXo hY ]769]
transliteration: Pher(i) Bagade Deeyo Har(i)joo Kahijaae Giryo Su Nahiudaryo Hai|| Mochh Bhaitihkihar(i) Ke Kar Chhodhvat Hisu Daryo Na Daryo Hai||769||
translation: Krishna once again raised and threw him and he could not get up again; he attained salvation at the hands of Krishna and expired without a battle.769.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtk gRMqy kiRSnw Avqwry biRKBwsur dYq bDh DXwie smwpqm squ suBm squ ]
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitraa Naatak Granthe Krishnaa Avtdare Brikhbhaasur Dait Badhah Dhayaae Samaaptam Sat(u) Soubham Sat(u)||
translation: End of the Chapter entitled “Killing of the demon Vrishabhasura” in Krishnavatara in Bachittar Natak.
Now begins the description of the killing of the demon Keshi

gurmukhi: ju`Du bfo kr kY iqh ky sMg jau Bgvwn bfo Air mwrXo ] nwrd qau mQrw mY gXo bcnw sMg kMs ky AYsy aucwrXo ]
transliteration: Juddh(u) Bado Kar Kai Tih Ke San Jau Bhagvaan Bado At(i) Mdaryo|| Naarad Tau Mathraa Mai Gado Bachnaa San Kans Ke Aise Ouchdaryo||
translation: While fighting with Vrishabhasura, when Lord Krishna killed the great enemy, then Narada went to Mathura and said to Kansa,

gurmukhi: qU BgnIpq nMd suqw hir qÍY irpvw Gr BIqr fwrXo ] dYq AGwsur Aau bk bIr mrXo iqnhUM jb paurK hwrXo ]770]
transliteration: Too Bhagneepat Nand Soutaa Har(i) Tvai Ripvaa Ghar Bheetar Dait Aghaasur Au Bak Beer Daryo Tinhoon Jah Paurakh Hdaryo||770||
translation: “The husband of your sister, the daughter of Nand and Krishna – all these enemies of yours are prospering in your kingdom; it was through them that Aghasura and Bakasura were defeated and killed.”770.

gurmukhi: kop BrXo mn mY mQurwpiq icq krI ieh ko Ab mrIXY ] ieh kI sm kwrj Aaur kCU nih qw bD Awpn aUbrIXY ]
transliteration: Kop Bdaryo Man Mai Mathuraa-pat(i) Chit Karieh Ko Ab Dareeyai|| Eh Kisam Kaaraj Aur Kachhodh Nah(i) Taa Badh Aapan Oodareeyai||
translation: Kansa, the king of Mathura, getting infuriated in his mind, resolved that they may be killed by any means; there is no other work of so much importance before me; I must fulfil this task at the earliest and save myself by killing my would-be killer;

gurmukhi: qb nwrd bol auTXo his k sunIXY niRp kwrj Xw krIXY ] Cl so bl so kib sXwm khY Apny Air ko isrvw hrIXY ]771]
transliteration: Tah Naarad Bol Outhyo Has(i) Kai Souneeyai Nrip Kaaraj Yaa Dareeyai|| Chhal So Bal So Kahi Syaam Kahai Apne Ar(i) Ko Sirvaa Dareeyai||771||
translation: Then Narada said smilingly, “O King! You must definitely perform this one task and with deceit or strength or any other means, slash the head of your enemy.”771.
Speech of Kansa addressed to Narada:
